meanings.definition: Prevent or obstruct (an anticipated event or action) by taking action ahead of time.
meanings.sent1: She wanted to forestall any arguments by offering a compromise.
meanings.sent2: The police set up roadblocks to forestall the escape of the criminal.
meanings.sent3: To forestall any mishaps, she packed an extra umbrella.
meanings.sent4: His quick thinking forestalled a potential disaster.
meanings.sent5: The early warning system helped forestall the approaching storm.

meanings.definition: Anticipate and deal with (a situation) in advance.
meanings.sent1: He tried to forestall any delays by leaving for the airport early.
meanings.sent2: The company implemented new policies to forestall future financial crises.
meanings.sent3: To forestall any confusion, she wrote detailed instructions.
meanings.sent4: Her proactive approach helped forestall any misunderstandings.
meanings.sent5: The team meeting was held to forestall any potential problems.
